page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: Our survey area contains more agricultural land than residential land. The residential land comes up to the northern border of the city of Plymouth. It covers the Bere Ferrers peninsula which you can only get to by going all the way up to Gunnislake or taking the train. The only square with lots of houses in is the square with our school in. There are three woods in the area, Warleigh Wood, Whitleigh Wood, and Yappers Wood. There are also two marshes in the area Whitleigh Marsh and Blaxton Marsh. The squares are bisected by the rivers Tamar, Tavy and Tamerton lake, or "the creek" as it is known locally. The squares cover Tamerton Foliot, part of Whitleigh and lower Ernesettle. Ben Perry
